message: I can't seem to discard these changes...
However both fuzzyfinder and l9 are doing something that results in them being dirtied
Just converted my bundle dir to use submodules following http://vimcasts.org/episodes/synchronizing-plugins-with-git-submodules-and-pathogen/

Changes not staged for commit:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
#   (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
#   (commit or discard the untracked or modified content in submodules)
#
#	modified:   bundle/fuzzyfinder (untracked content)
#	modified:   bundle/l9 (untracked content)

diffing it yields

diff --git a/bundle/fuzzyfinder b/bundle/fuzzyfinder
--- a/bundle/fuzzyfinder
+++ b/bundle/fuzzyfinder
@@ -1 +1 @@
-Subproject commit b9f165970346df55862853dd83c8a4f2b2b70262
+Subproject commit b9f165970346df55862853dd83c8a4f2b2b70262-dirty

working around with

   git update-index --assume-unchanged bundle/fuzzyfinder
   git update-index --assume-unchanged bundle/l9

I also had a problem with the tags files getting written and git getting all bothered. In .gitmodules, add "ignore = untracked" to each module.  Then, some combination of git submodule commands and frustrated deletion should get things set up right.  DISCLAIMER:  As this is a vim group, no promises can be made as to the quality of git advice received herein.
